page.title: 15 The Town Hall.
page.content: The {Town Hall} was built in 1735 by Thomas Guy. There are six rooms, four large and two small. There is a large room which used to be used for Council meetings. The Mayor's Parlour is a comfortable smaller room. It contains the Mayor's robes and a cabinet full of silver and glassware which has been given to Tamworth over the years. The Mayor's {chain} is very heavy and is worth thirty thousand pounds. The present Mayor, Mr. Munn is a builder by profession. In July the Mayor of Tamworth in Australia is visiting the town. Although the Council now meets at Marmion House the Town Hall is still used by groups every week. The arches under the main room was the site of the old butter market.
